item.title: 'You're an old man now': Longtime friend urges Joe Biden to withdraw from US Presidential race
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Some mullahs are ... ': Human rights body condemns clerics for promoting 'misogynistic videos' in Pakistan
item.description: HRCP condemns misogynistic videos on social media, advocating for girls' education and women's rights. Urgent state intervention is required to combat hate speech and promote respect for women in Pakistan. "The Human Rights Commission of Pakistan (HRCP) has strongly condemned some videos posted on social media in which some right-wing mullahs have appealed to parents to withdraw their girls from school, saying that schools are Education promotes 'obscenity'", it said in a post on X.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Jordan Bardella, France's far-right leader eyeing PM post
item.description: Jordan Bardella, 28, and Marine Le Pen are vying for victory in France's snap parliamentary election called by President Macron after a defeat in the European elections. Bardella aims for a parliamentary majority, promising to reduce undocumented migration, boost purchasing power, and reform education. The RN has rebranded, distancing from past controversies to appeal to moderate voters.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Step inside Balmoral: UK royals to open castle for public after 170 years
item.description: Balmoral Castle, a long-private royal retreat, is opening its doors to the public for the first time in 170 years. Visitors can explore historic rooms, including those redecorated by King Charles with the original Victorian style favored by Queen Victoria. Tickets, priced at Â£100-150 with afternoon tea, sold out quickly. This rare opportunity offers a glimpse into the royal family's cherished holiday home.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Xi Jinping to visit Kazakhstan, Tajikistan from July 2 to 6, says Chinese foreign ministry
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 2 killed, 1 missing after torrential rains trigger landslide in Switzerland
item.description: Two people have died, and another is missing after torrential rains led to a landslide in southeastern Switzerland, according to an AFP report citing local police.The Alpine nation faced severe storms over the weekend, prompting the evacuation of hundreds in the west after the Rhone River and its tributaries overflowed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Opposition in Pakistan's Punjab assembly holds its own session, vows not to accept Maryam Nawaz as CM
item.description: Amidst escalating tensions in the Punjab Assembly, opposition lawmakers rejected Maryam Nawaz as chief minister, leading to suspensions and a walkout. The government's actions, including sealing the opposition leader's chamber, sparked protests and a privilege motion. The budget was eventually passed, and the House proceedings adjourned indefinitely.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 7 killed and dozens wounded after missiles slammed into a town in southern Ukraine, officials say
Israel extends cooperation between Israeli and Palestinian banks, official says
Video shows Israeli driver's car set on fire after he mistakenly enters Palestinian territory
item.description: Amidst violence in the West Bank, I encountered armed confrontations after my car was torched by locals, reflecting the aftermath of the Gaza conflict and Israel's control seizure. Video footage circulated on social media footage shows a group of Palestinians pursuing the vehicle and pelting it with rocks, The Times of Israel reported.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Armed Forces Day: King Charles unveils portrait in military attire
item.description: Despite challenges, I continue to honor the army with a new portrait in military attire. Queen Camilla and I express gratitude to service members and military families. Amid public engagements, I host dignitaries and uphold the tradition of military service, despite portrait vandalism at the gallery.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Polls open in France's high-stakes snap parliamentary elections
item.description: Voting got underway in mainland France on Sunday in the first round of snap parliamentary elections, with Marine Le Pen's anti-immigrant and eurosceptic far-right party eyeing power in a historic first.

item.title: Russia says it destroyed 36 Ukrainian drones in its southwest region
item.description: Russian defence forces destroyed drones near Kursk and Lipetsk, with additional drones downed in Voronezh, Bryansk, Oryol, and Belgorod. No injuries or significant damage were reported in the attacks. Russian officials are criticized for incomplete disclosure of damage. There was no immediate response from Ukraine. Ukraine contends these actions have been retaliatory to Russian aggression since 2022.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: France votes in high-stakes election as far-right eyes historic victory
item.description: French voters around the world are participating in the first round of a significant parliamentary election, which could potentially put France's government under the control of far-right forces for the first time since the Nazi era. This two-round election will conclude on July 7 and may have major consequences for European financial markets, Western support for Ukraine, and the management of France's nuclear arsenal and global military force. Many French voters are expressing dissatisfaction with inflation, economic challenges, and President Emmanuel Macron's leadership.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Taiwan detects five Chinese military aircraft and seven naval vessels near its territory
item.description: Taiwan's Ministry of National Defence reported five Chinese military aircraft and seven naval vessels operating around Taiwan from Saturday to Sunday. This included incursions into Taiwan's Air Defence Identification Zone (ADIZ). Taiwan's armed forces monitored and responded to the situation. This incident follows increased Chinese military activities around Taiwan, asserting sovereignty claims and leading to heightened regional tensions.

item.title: Nigeria: At least 18 people killed, 48 others injured in bomb blasts in Borno
item.description: At least 18 people were killed and 48 injured in bomb blasts in Nigeria's Borno state, CNN reported. The first explosion hit a wedding, followed by blasts at General Hospital Gwoza and a funeral. Borno State Emergency Management Agency (SEMA) confirmed men, women, and children among the deceased. SEMA Director General Barkindo Muhammad Saidu visited the site.

item.title: Suspected suicide bombers kill at least 18 in Nigeria, authorities say
item.description: Barkindo Saidu, director general of the Borno State Emergency Management Agency, said suspected suicide bombers separately attacked a wedding, funeral and hospital, killing and injuring several people in the town of Gwoza. Saidu said 18 deaths had been confirmed, a toll that included children, adults and pregnant women. "The degree of injuries ranges from abdominal ruptures, scull fractures, and limb fractures," he said. Borno is at the centre of a 15-year Islamist insurgency that has killed thousands of people and displaced millions more.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China's June factory activity contracts for second month
item.description: In the face of economic challenges, China's manufacturing sector struggles, prompting the need for stimulus measures. Disappointing output numbers, uncertain export sales sustainability, and a persistent property crisis add to the complexity, requiring interventions to boost investment and counter the sluggish growth.

item.title: A private call of top Democrats fuels more insider anger about Biden's debate performance
item.description: Democratic leaders are concerned about Biden's debate performance impact, prompting calls for him to step aside. Despite this, Biden and his allies remain confident in his ability to compete against Trump. Post-debate polling results are eagerly awaited to gauge the situation.

item.title: No place for Hinduphobia in UK, says Labour leader
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON
